dialogues.text: Is he here in Borderdale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, he's in a prison camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, you put your hand under the water and  I'll pump for you. She pumps and DAVID puts his hand under the cool, flowing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Camille -- Camille Johnson and I'm  the Supervisor of this school. What's your  name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Lee Morgan. My dog's name is Sounder.  (takes his hand out  from under the water)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That feels better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see it... She takes his hand into hers -- pulls a kerchief from her the water off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hand needs medicine on it. You better come  with me into the school so I can put something  on it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She applies some medication to his wound -- he winces for then she begins to wrap it in a bandage -- DAVID keeps lo room, admiring its cleanliness, the long blackboard, the student chairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep looking around, David. Don't you go to  school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometime, but not like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing your hand did not become  infected -- how did you cut it like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Sounder went to this prison camp to see my Daddy and the police guard runs us away and  I fell on some glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your mother know you were going to see your  father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completes the bandaging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Miss Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't live far from here. You and your dog  can come home with me and have yourself a hot  meal and then we'll talk about how to get you  back home.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAMILLE'S PLACE
dialogues.text: DAVID walks about CAMILLE'S quaint, neat little home with he looks around and about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a pretty house, Miss Johnson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. DAVID spots the many books she has on a shelf shelf as she stands next to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a lotta books, too.  (scanning the books)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any books with people in 'em like  Huckleberry Finn? She turns in a quick, reflex motion, directly to the boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no! DAVID breaks out in a big smile because he is glad to kno books like Huckleberry Finn. She returns his smile, and p one of the books --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me tell you something about the books  on this shelf: This one's about a man whose  name was Crispus Attucks. He fought in a war to  help this country to become the United States.  And this one is about a woman who helped to  free slaves. Her name was Harriet Tubman,  and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMILLE finishes washing the dishes -- moves for the sitt trails her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you say all them people is dead now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves into the room with DAVID following her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lived a long time ago -- before you and I  were born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Africa, Miss Johnson? She moves to her desk and pulls out a drawer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here and I'll show you. She opens the desk drawer -- gets down on the floor and s DAVID sits down next to her as she goes over the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is, right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we come from first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we came from first. She rises from the floor and puts the map back into the d moves to the book shelf --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the other people you told me 'bout, they is  all colored folk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you teach in your school 'bout folk who  ain't dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure-- She moves to the shelf next to him and takes a book from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's one by a man that's very much alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. William E. B. Dubois.  (fingers through the book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he talk 'bout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you sit and I'll read you something  he said. She sits in a chair at the desk and he takes a place on t beneath her, waiting anxiously for her to begin the readi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads from the book)

dialogues.speaker: THE LONGING OF BLACK MEN MUST HAVE RESPECT --
dialogues.text: (she diverts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means that a man and a woman are human  and must be treated that way-- (she returns to the text)

dialogues.speaker: THE UNKNOWN TREASURES OF THEIR INNER LIFE--
dialogues.text: As she reads, DAVID'S mind and imagination take to drawin images of what he can apply to his intuitive understandin reading to him --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID'S IMAGES
dialogues.text: The night in the woods with his father and SOUNDER. The s after the baseball game --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID'S IMAGES
dialogues.text: HE, JOSIE and EARL, running and playing in the field.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID'S IMAGES
dialogues.text: His visit with his father at the County Jail house --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID'S IMAGES
dialogues.text: His mother, with her head thrown back, her eyes aglitter CAMILLE has finished reading -- she places the book down looks on her from the poor with tenderness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a friendly lady, Miss Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're a tired little boy. I'll make up the  cot and you must get some sleep. She moves into the corner to prepare a place for him in t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Sounder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll get his place too -- now off with your  clothes and into bed. DAVID unclothes himself and crawls into the bed as CAMILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't you think it's time you told me all  about yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a mother and her name is Rebecca -- My  father's name is Nathan Lee Morgan, and...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: CAMILLE is standing in front of her desk before an overfi DAVID LEE is seated in a chair against a wall on one side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone here know what chapter that story was  from? A boy rises with abrupt and fast confidence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapter twenty-six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-six? The text has but six chapters! BOY #l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I meant, Miss Johnson. Take away  the two in front and all you got left is a six! The class room breaks out in a gusto of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know I'm not going to have the  laughing! The laughing dies sharply and quickly -- CAMILLE smiles t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get back to you later, Mr. Twenty-six.  Let's not stop now, we have to keep this mood  moving. The story has to come from one of the  text books we've already read in class, or it  has to be a true story of your own. Let's get  it going now -- we don't have that much time  left... She moves around and sits at her desk -- after some indec all of the Children, one boy finally rises from his chair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a story, Miss Johnson -- It's a true  story that happened to me. CLARENCE is a soft-eyed boy about eleven or twelve years as if he's not too sure he wants to tell his story --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that the class is going to challenge  your story, don't you, Clarence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Johnson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my little sister, went down to the water  hole, last Saturday-- A GIRL rises and interrupts him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doin' somethin' wrong already -- You  didn't tell us the name of your sister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister's name is...  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my sister, Laura, went down to the water  hole last Saturday and we was playin' 'long the  edge of the water and Laura slipped and fell in  the water. I started to run back home, but I  turned around, ran back, dove into the water  and got her out before she could drown... No one says anything -- CLARENCE just stands there, looki waiting for someone to utter something -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your sister after you pulled her out of  the water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was dirty and wet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doin', runnin' away from the  water?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going home to get my daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What made you stop and go back!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause if I hadda ran home, by the time I got  back, my sister woulda drowned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you didn't know that at first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! Clarence's story ain't true! Me and  Clarence been to the river a lotta times, and  I know, he can't swim!

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: She is somewhat thrown -- hesitates but must follow throu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence, would you tell us a story that was  not true, after telling us it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Miss Johnson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes mam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence, you know you can't swim! Every time I  tried to show you, you fell down, and I had to  always pull you out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true, Clarence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes mam... But when I saw my sister 'bout to  drown in the water, I tried because I wasn't  scared no more! I was just swimming and kickin'!  I don't know how I was doin' it! But I was,  cause my sister was drowning! She was drowning!

dialogues.speaker: CLASS ROOM
dialogues.text: CLARENCE sits -- the class is silent --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID LEE
dialogues.text: DAVID LEE has been deeply involved in everything that has room. As he sits, he is split with indecision as to wheth and say something or to remain in his place. But he makes and rises --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe Clarence's story...

dialogues.speaker: CLASS ROOM
dialogues.text: All eyes turn to David Lee --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come forward and tell us why,  David? He hesitates for a moment -- he moves and stands before t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people came and took my daddy away and  other people said we couldn't work the farm.  But we had to,'cause we didn't wanna lose our  farm. We planted the crops and they grew. I  believe his story 'cause his story is about  what he did when he had to do somethin'. He  didn't know how to swim but he had to or else  his sister woulda drowned. That's how he did  it... He looks around to CAMILLE, and then he moves back to the and sits and then the class room breaks out in applause -

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: He is happy to know that his story has finally been accep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face too is beaming with laughter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMILLE and DAVID LEE exit from the school house -- DAVID excitement over his adventure in the class room. They are who is impatiently waiting for DAVID. DAVID LEE strokes t and they keep moving on out of the school yard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how did you like the class, David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the best thing I ever been to, Miss  Johnson! They move out of the school yard towards town.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAMILLE'S PLACE
dialogues.text: CAMILLE is busying herself, sweeping, dusting furniture i in place, etc. -- DAVID LEE is following her about the pl wherever he can -- His spirits are very high at the momen crouched in a corner, looking on at the activity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So me and Sounder, ran right by the men  that was the prisoners, and crawled under the  fence! That's when I cut my hand on the glass.  It hurt like mad! But I kept runnin', and then  I didn't feel no more hurtin' till I stopped  runnin'!  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was that, Miss Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because all you could think of was getting away  from the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... (pause).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You right, that's all that was worryin' me right  then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that was a good thing you did for  Clarence, in class today. I believed his story,  but I was afraid the other children wouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was real scared nobody would believe him -- I  could tell, even when he first stood up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been like that myself, when I thought nobody  was gonna believe me...  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna hear another story?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, David, it's time for bed. You have a  long trip ahead of you in the morning... A thought grips the boy, and he moves to the window, and darkness, as CAMILLE starts to make the bed for him -- sh moment, and looks up and over at him at the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at, out there? There's  nothing to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy likes to look into the dark, even when  there ain't nothin to see -- it's what you hear  he say. CAMILLE notices and feels that his mood has changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think about your father a lot, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes mam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you shouldn't worry about him too much,  David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I tell my mama when I get home? I  didn't find him and that's what I wanted to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you did all you could, David. Not many  little boys could've gone on such a journey as  you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where is my daddy!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't answer that for you -- but it's no  fault of your own that you don't know where  your father is now. You tell me what you did  that kept you from finding your father. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so you did your job, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, mam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whewwww! You sure keep my mind jumping, boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means you keep me using my head, and that's  good! She returns to making up the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Johnson... Do you think I can come back  here, and you let me study school with the  other children? The question stops her work -- and then she momentarily s answer for the boy -- she sits down on the bed as he turn of the window. She looks on him for a moment, rises, move puts her arm around his shoulder -- and they both look ou the blank darkness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSIE MAE is on the porch with EARL when she spots DAVID road, rushing toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama! Mama! She and EARL rush out to the road to meet them -- REBECCA front door behind them. DAVID is carrying two books given They all reach him about the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, David! Sounder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you? I've been worried out of  my life. What's wrong with your hand, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cut it on some glass and we got lost, Mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't see 'im, Mama. The other men there say  they didn't know Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess they musta sent 'im to another camp. They all start moving for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that you carryin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some books Miss Johnson gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Miss Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Johnson is a teacher, and... They move on through the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter -- DAVID and the other children sit at the tab to prepare something for the boy to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when I left, she gave me these books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Johnson must be a real kindly lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is, Mama... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the fall comes, she wants me to come to  her school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you do that? You don't live anywhere  near that school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says I can come live with her while school  goin' on, and come back home every time there  ain't no school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who's gonna help me here with the house and  in the field? She puts some food on the table before him -- he hesitate she is about to exit through the back door -- stops in th back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your father is back by then it's all right  with me if it'll be all right with him... REBECCA moves out just like that, leaving the boy thrown moment -- he looks in the direction of his mother's room slowly starts to eat, with his appetite practically gone EARL on the other side of the table are staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha starin' at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us some more 'bout the trip! EXTs. CORNFIELD-WEIGHING STATION - DAY  A hot, mid-July day -- late afternoon -- REBECCA, DAVID L EARL are working the mill. DAVID LEE points with his fingers in giving out assignmen EARL. They run across the fields to a particular row of c sacks in their hands. JOSIE MAE and EARL are behind REBECCA, picking the corn i back to the stationary place where they left their croker corn into the sacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white man in a wagon rolls in the aisle between the row the wagon at each sack, where REBECCA and DAVID LEE load wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wagon rolls up to the weighing station on MR. HOWARD' to a halt -- REBECCA and DAVID LEE climb down from the wa there. REBECCA and DAVID LEE unload the sacks from the wagon, an the scale, while the man who was driving the wagon writes numbers on a piece of paper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA, JOSIE MAE and EARL are gathered around DAVID LEE completes writing a letter -- he sits back to read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Miss Johnson. How are you? I am doing  okay. I told my mama, my brother and my sister  about you, and they like you too. I can't make  this letter too long because I have work to do.  Bless you, David Lee Morgan" They all look to each other with big triumphant smiles of faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, you sure write a good fine letter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID LEE walks through the woods with a book in his hand down at the base of a tree, when suddenly he reacts as if -- he rises and rushes away -- he runs, stops and looks a of someone, and then he takes off again at high speed alo woods. His speed builds and builds, and suddenly he break night, into high grass field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is broad daylight, and the sun is shining -- DAVID LEE looks about the field of high grass -- he hears a voice a until he breaks the high grass into open field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees his father, with SOUNDER at his side, standing ab feet away from him, smiling. He rushes to his father -- t they start to run across the open field, the three of the run, keeping pace with each other, as their speed increas his book, stops to pick it up -- after he straightens up continue the running, he stops in his tracks -- his fathe nowhere to be seen -- he looks out over the entire field there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID LEE wakes up -- he looks to EARL and JOSIE MAE, and darkness of the room, and wonders; where did the dream co it go to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later the same day, DAVID LEE is lying on his stomach, re his books. REBECCA is doing some sewing -- SOUNDER comes of the house, hobbling back and forth to the road and bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him, David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's when the heat is so bad, dogs go crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't go mad -- he's just lookin' for a  cooler spot. REBECCA sees a lone figure upon the landscape way out fro as a speck and slowly grow into a ripply form through the MAE and EARL come from around the house and sit down in t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that to be fightin' scorchin' heat out in  open land like that? SOUNDER moves about restlessly in the yard -- and then su the great coon hound breaks the sultry August deadness an road toward the figure. REBECCA jumps to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone mad! Stop him, David! DAVID LEE takes off after SOUNDER -- his voice is ringing keeps moving until he arrives at the figure. REBECCA sees take the dog into his arms, and now the light hits at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, it's Nathan! It's Nathan!!! She drops everything and charges off the porch with JOSIE making haste behind her. MEDIUM ANGLE - REBECCA, JOSIE MAE and EARL - PORCH POV As they dash across the road and into the field, almost i motion.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN FAMILY
dialogues.text: DAVID LEE falls into his father's arms -- REBECCA embrace close to her -- JOSIE MAE and EARL move into his embrace back and forth around them -- DAVID LEE jumps up and down start moving toward the house -- NATHAN moves with an acc right leg, and then they stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your leg, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it hurt in a dynamite blast, son. The dirty  dogs had no more use for me, so they let me  have time off my sentence, and let me come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most important thing is that you're home!  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was gonna have cold eatin' tonight, 'cause  of the heat, but now, I'm goin' to cook!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's get to it, Miss Rebecca,'cause I  been waitin' too long a time for your good  cookin'! They move out of the field and across the road for their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN and the children are at the table just after eatin busying herself in the area, cleaning up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can say, Rebecca, is that was some meal!  Thank you! She stops her work, turns to him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you liked it, Nathan.  She returns to her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, children, it was your bedtime two  hours ago -- let's get a move on you... JOSIE MAE and EARL rise and move around the table to thei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Daddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight to you, little girl. He kisses her on the face and then EARL moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night, Daddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, son... He embraces EARL -- and then the two children move for th REBECCA accompanying them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, that was some trip you went on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was you, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That musta been afta they sent me to this place  call Clayburn. That was the hardest workin'  camp they sent me to. The work was so hard,  you had to look for somethin' to laugh about to  keep from feelin' the whole pain in your body.  Like one time, it was in the middle of the day,  and there weren't no sun -- you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did the sun go to, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the clouds and behind the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened afta that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rains started to come, and the prisoners  were scared to run 'cause they had to wait for  guards to round us up, and tell us when to move -- but we didn't mind the rain comin' 'cause it  meant we would git a little rest -- we just  stood there, watchin' the guards and they  weapons get wet, and that made us all feel  kinda good for a minute. I was laughin' all  over inside -- a minute, that's all, but what  a minute it was! He laughs -- DAVID LEE laughs along with him -- the laugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I'm so glad you home! NATHAN reaches across the table and shakes the boy's head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And me too, son! You shore done got to be such  a big little man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We goin' huntin' again, Daddy !?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet we is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cleaned and oiled all your stuff while you  was gone... REBECCA re-enters from the children's room, crosses for h the door, and turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your time now, David Lee...  She enters the room -- DAVID LEE rises from the table, mo and extends his hand out to him for a shake -- they shake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Daddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight to you, son...  DAVID LEE moves for his room, stops and turns back to his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, you home now... that's all I want -- I  don't want nothin' else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, son... DAVID LEE moves closer to him -- NATHAN takes the boy int holds him close. He releases him -- the boy smiles, turns room. NATHAN looks on the door for awhile where the boy h from the table and moves into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An expression of soft thoughts and affection.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN LEE
dialogues.text: NATHAN is in bed, asleep. He turns over and as he does, h of DAVID LEE -- He props himself on his elbow to come out looks to the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin', son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin', Daddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FULL ANGLE - NATHAN and DAVID LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gone to the field...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I can't just lay here, then. He lifts himself up and sits on the edge of the bed, rubs his hair -- reacts, looking down on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he looks to his father with affection --

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: DAVID LEE crosses to a chair, takes up his father's trous chair and his shoes from the floor and passes them on to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, son...  He begins to slowly put on his clothes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel alright today, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, son -- not like wakin' up in jail. For a  minute or two, didn't quite know where I was,  but when I saw your face lookin down on me,  made me know right away the day was gonna be a  good one, and it all belonged to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he smiles down to the boy-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID LEE
dialogues.text: As he returns his father's smile -

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: As they both exit from the room -- NATHAN LEE leading the

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: They keep moving to the kitchen area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama left somethin' for you to eat on the  stove-- They arrive at the stove -- NATHAN takes the cover off a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells good, too! He turns away from the stove, and they move out the backd

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Just as they step out into the yard, they are immediately

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there, big boy!  SOUNDER leaps all over him -- he wrestles playfully with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They thought one little ol' shotgun was gonna  stop you -- you showed huh, boy! SOUNDER continues to paw all over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down boy! That's enough! SOUNDER turns to DAVID who kneels to stroke and caress hi the water well, and begins to wash up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, when is we goin' huntin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon -- but it won't be too much huntin' you'll  be doin','cordin' to a good little story your  mama told me last night -- you'll be goin' away  from here, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN'S question seems to stab the boy, and he sinks int silence.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: He waits a moment for the boy to reply, then moves for th DAVID LEE looks on the blank door of the shed where NATHA rises from the ground and he and SOUNDER move into the sh

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: DAVID LEE and SOUNDER enter and stop just inside the door over his equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kept my stuff in real good shape, son. He takes up his baseball glove and a ball -- tries the gl -- then tosses the ball to DAVID. DAVID catches it -- NAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, son, throw a couple to me! He moves briskly out of the shed back into the yard -- DA out behind him --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: NATHAN moves to the house end of the yard -- DAVID takes field end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, chunk it to me! DAVID throws the ball softly and it lands in NATHAN's glo ball back to DAVID -- DAVID catches it in his bare hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me have one with a little steam on it, now! DAVID rears back and fires a hard one at him. It pops int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy that was a mean curve you just threw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID rears back once again, and throws a hard one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough for now, son. I better eat so we  can get out to the field and help your mama  before she come lookin' for us, and you know  how tough your mama can get!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA, JOSIE MAE, and EARL are working the field when M in his truck -- He gets out and approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ya, Rebecca...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the cynical truth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks about the field)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody told me Nathan was back. How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you pay him a visit, Mr. Howard?   He'll tell you all about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do that, Rebecca... I'll do that... MR HOWARD moves back to his truck and drives off. As they move away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn to see NATHAN limping toward them with SOUN They wait until they arrive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To invite you to his house -- the two of you  could just sit under the shade tree, drink ice cold whiskey, and just shoot the breeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell 'im I was too busy for that kinda  stuff? He puts his arms around her shoulders, and draws her clos children stand by with big wide open smiles on their face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! It shore feels good to be back home! He releases her -- walks about twelve feet away -- inspec -- looks about over the field --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all did some good job with the crop. He turns and walks back to them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's get to work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you feel up to it, Nathan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I feel real up to it right now. Come on,  David Lee, you and me'll do the loading. REBECCA and the other children start in with the picking, NATHAN with concern as he, DAVID LEE and SOUNDER move thr finally, she returns her full attention to the work --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm real proud of how you helped your mama to  keep this place goin', David Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Daddy... They come to a group of corn-filled sacks alongside the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll lift up the back end, and you just hold on  to the front end for me. He lifts up the back end of the sack -- DAVID LEE takes h tied end, and they struggle to get it up on the wagon, wi and groaning. The same thing happens with the second sack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeew! This is some hard work, but it beats  goin' to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be goin' to jail again, will you,  Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, son -- they'd have to kill me before I'd  let 'em do that to me again! He realizes he has said the wrong thing from the worried face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's goin' to jail, and nobody's gittin'  hurt. Come on, let's get this one up on the  wagon. NATHAN reaches down for the bag -- his leg gives way on h his behind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hurt, Daddy!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I'm all right, son... This damn leg  just won't act right no more! He tries to get up right away but the leg is in such pain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama! Mama! REBECCA and the other children come running toward them -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Nathan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't get up, Mama!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This done happen before. It ain't nothin' -- I  just have to wait a minute or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something I can do to help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just stay where you is... He supports himself on his right arm and slowly pushes hi can stand on his foot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see, all right -- It's time for us to get out  of this field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lunchtime, and I wanna have a talk with  you, Nathan Lee. Come on, children... She turns briskly and moves off with JOSIE MAE and EARL f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman worries too much for me. He slowly starts to limp away with SOUNDER but DAVID LEE where he is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is worry and concern in his face as he watches his walk on the injured leg --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FULL ANGLE - NATHAN LEE, SOUNDER and DAVID LEE  As NATHAN stops and turns to DAVID LEE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You comin' with us, son? After a bit of hesitation, DAVID LEE slowly moves toward now turned and is moving farther out of the field --

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: REBECCA is sitting on the porch, cutting string beans -- are playing hop scotch -- DAVID LEE is tossing the baseba IKE enters the yard -- he has a white envelope in his han standing near NATHAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ya doin' there, Ike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time it's Saturday and I don't hafta do any  work, I'm doin' okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems this piece of mail came to Mr. Howard's  place this mornin' and he had me to bring it  over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't belong to you! It's for the little  important man, here! He hands it to DAVID LEE -- DAVID LEE does not look at th takes it -- Everyone's attention is to DAVID LEE and the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, son, who is it from?  DAVID LEE hesitates for a moment, then holds the letter u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Miss Johnson --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, ain't you gon' open and read it for us? He looks directly to his father, and then to his mother - and sits. They all gather closer to him as he takes his t envelope. When it is opened -- he seems not to want to re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear David, if you are coming to school here,  be sure to bring some warm clothes. The school  term will begin September 8th, but it would be  good for you to be here by the 4th or 5th of  the month. I do hope everything is fine and you  will be here. Give my "hello" to your family.  Yours truly, Miss Camille Johnson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: September 4 -- how far away is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout a week... With directness, NATHAN LEE moves toward the wagon in fro stops and turns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, children, let's go! Moves on to the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN climbs up on the wagon and SOUNDER leaps up behind and EARL follow. DAVID LEE steps down into the yard and m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin'!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the commissary to get this boy some clothes!  I'm gon' get everybody somethin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Nathan--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me nothin' 'bout what we owe ol' man  Howard! I'll do the owing, and let him worry  'bout the collecting! Come on, David Lee! DAVID LEE does not move from where he is standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me, boy? Come on! DAVID LEE moves slowly to the wagon stops and looks up to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just came back home, Daddy. I don't wanna  leave right now -- I wanna stay home and be  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I wanta be with you, too, but this school  is somethin' that's good for you -- somethin  you need, like good air to breathe, and I want  you to have it, boy, and that's the way it's  gonna be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Daddy, you need me here to help you in the  field -- Daddy, your leg is hurt -- you can't  work like you used to. Who's gonna help you!?  Who's gonna do the work, Daddy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs him by one arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you somethin', boy! I don't care if  both of my legs was cut off! I can do more  work in that field, than you could in a hundred  years!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't go, Daddy! I won't go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait justa minute! You don't tell me what  you ain't gonna do! I tell you! I say, you  goin' to that school, you goin'! You hear me! He releases the boy, climbs back up on the wagon, and loo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a look of confused sadness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, don't make me go away from you.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN LEE
dialogues.text: The boys words have rendered him speechless -- he doesn't do or say for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: DAVID LEE turns and runs out into the field --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David! The boy keeps running -- NATHAN climbs down from the wago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Lee, come back here! REBECCA rushes down from the porch and moves for NATHAN -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan! NATHAN LEE stops in his tracks, his back to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, leave him be, Nathan! He missed you in  a grave way while you was gone -- he sweated  and worried to find out where they holdin' you  -- went on that long journey -- you come home,  and it's a natural thing for him to wanta hold  on to you now.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN LEE
dialogues.text: As he rakes a long hard look to her -- turns, and moves o find the boy -- SOUNDER follows him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she watches him move out into the field --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves about the field in search of DAVID -- He move -- farther and farther into the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David! David Lee! He gets no response to his call -- He moves on and on abo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David! You hear me callin' you!? He moves on even farther, and finally he spots the boy, s lump of earth with his face down between his legs, crying and then slowly moves to the boy and sits beside him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, will you listen to me for a minute? After a minute's hesitation, DAVID slowly raises his head his father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, son, when I got this leg hurt, I was  down in a rock quarry, and all of a sudden,  there was this dynamite blast comin' at me with  the kind of force to kill ten men, but I got  outta the way of most of them rock, quicker'n  the lightnin' in God's mind -- 'cause I made it  up in my head, just that quick to beat the  death that was comin' at me. And that's what  I'm gonna do with this trouble in my leg. I'm  gon' beat it. That's all that's left for me to  do. That's what I want you to do. I want you to  beat the life they got laid out for you in this  valley. DAVID LEE looks directly at him and then turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watchin' your sister and brother out here  the other day, and I said to myself, these is  just children -- they ain't got no business out  here in this hot sun... As for me and your  mama, we been in this field so long, we ain't  never known anything else. DAVID LEE is looking straight out and away from him. NATH hesitates -- finally the boy holds his hands up before hi his hands, rises and moves away from his father -- stops away. About three rows away, the white man is driving thr truck -- They watch the truck move on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ain't nothin' here but people like them  bastards that sent me away, and tried to kill  me. Son, please don't get too used to this  place. I'm gonna love you wherever you is. Me,  your mama, Josie Mae and Earl, we gonna love  you even more. We gonna be at that school to  see you every chance we get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they look to each other -- their eyes drawing them clo and then DAVID rushes into his father's waiting arms --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, son! Don't ever think I don't love  you!  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gon' get to be friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Daddy! Yes! NATHAN holds the boy out from him -- They just look to ea wipes his eyes and calms down. They start moving out of t

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN AND DAVID LEE
dialogues.text: As they make their way out of the field --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: DAVID LEE is packing a bag with SOUNDER nearby him as JOS on -- when he is done, he closes the bag [and hands it] o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, get a move on you, bag boy! EARL drops the bag on the floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You carry your own bag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll carry it, David... EARL quickly picks the bag back up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I'm carryin' it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Josie Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Earl helpin' me out with my bag! He laughs as they all move out of the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the children exit from the house, REBECCA is at the wa NATHAN as he loads a box of DAVID'S things on the wagon - and he takes the bag from EARL and loads it up on the wag to the reins, SOUNDER hops up on the wagon, and then REBE her arms --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be good and be smart, little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'm... She releases him. He embraces JOSIE and EARL -- Climbs on his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I oughta be gettin' back here by tomorrow night  some time... Gitttt! The wagon rolls away -- DAVID turns back to wave --

dialogues.speaker: BYE...
dialogues.text: REBECCA keeps her eyes on the wagon for awhile, and then, children turn and slowly move into the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the wagon rolls up the road, DAVID LEE reaches back an about the neck -- looks out over the field, and all the p with -- turns to his father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know somethin', Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gon' miss this ol' raggedy place. NATHAN is worried for a moment -- but DAVID breaks out in he's about to get to the punchline of a joke --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I ain't gon' worry 'bout it!  The father and son break out in a gusto of laughter as th up the road...
